reviews: "I would recommend this card to fresh grads! Reason being it's simple to use and no complicated spending patterns needed to maintain your rewards. There are definitely other miles cards out there that would earn you more miles faster but the DBS points (which you use to convert to miles) do not expire and there is not minimum spend. So you won't be pressured to spend more just to hit minimum spend or minimum no. of points for conversion to miles. For that same reason you don't have to time your spending too.   ", "[Miles Card] It's a good card to gather miles and I use it as my main card. Can recommend it. Sometimes, the app is not accessible, but generally works well.", 'I would recommend this as the 1st credit card to get when you graduate from University. It’s a great card for travelling, with bonus miles to earn from booking flights and accommodations. It’s also usually one of the eligible cards when using it with 3rd party payment services like CardUp and Ipaymy. It also works with SimplyGo that lets you earn miles while commuting on public transport. Note that a similar card like the OCBC 90N doesn’t earn you miles when used with SimplyGo based on the recent OCBC revision. That gives the DBS Altitude a slight edge over cards similar to it.

Bill payment can also be made directly via digibank which is a plus point for someone who’s always busy! reviews: "Miles that don't expire, up to 6 miles per dollar on Expedia, definitely a must have card for any rookie miles chaser. The complimentary lounge excess is an icing on the cake. ", "In the realm of miles card for credit cards, DBS altitude visa is not a very good option. Only positive of this card is that miles do not expire", 'Given the low entry level for this card, I would give it 5 stars. ", "[Cashback Card]  It's for min. the requirement of the UOB One account.  It'll be subject to the spending benchmark on a quarterly basis, with capped at SGD3k/month. The saving grace is that the UOB One Card is the only cashback card in Singapore that will give you cash rebates on almost everything. Considering if you consolidate your daily spend like groceries, petrol, recurring bills etc. it should not be hard to achieve.

reviews: "Been using the One Card to get a higher interest rate for my One account. T", "Just logged in to see my rebate statement and realised I'm getting 0% or 0.3% for most transactions, even for dining. High minimum spending required to get the high % cashback. SGD800 per month is considered relatively high, compared to its competitors (UOB\'s min. spending is SGD500, DBS\'

It is now $800 min spending and cashback is capped at $80. For people to spend a lot on their cards and want to get cashback, it would be better to use another card, or to use this card in tandem with another card. For a young adult, this card suits my spending needs and habits so I am satisfied with the experience.

reviews: "OCBC has the worst customer service. They have very strict fee waiver policies for their credit cards.  And, if you accidentally forgot to pay your cc bills on time or if there is a technical delay over inter-bank payments, they will charge you late payment. If you do not hit the minimum spending $900/mth, you will be charged annual fee and you can't waive it off. So, no matter how much you try to earn the rebates and meet the 360 account conditions, it will be all gone with these strict annual fee and late payment charge. Also, it is known that the OCBC CSOs should not waive fee liberally.  So, avoid at all cost!!!", 'Decent product and generally fuss free- I use this mainly for dining out with friends (so minimum $600 is much easier to hit) and other misc things like groceries, grab rides etc.

Customer service is easily reachable via the hotline with decent waiting time as opposed to other major banks like OCBC. reviews: ["[Promotions and Perks] Get a pair of Apple Airpods 2 upon spending $900 within 3 months makes this an attractive card to get when I have a big-ticket purchase coming up soon.  [Card Hacks] It says 5-years of fee waivers, technically that means that this credit card is essentially free as I'll be graduating in less than 5-years, and would probably move to another card by then. It's a ", "Only needed this as a category to hit with the multiplier savings account. As a person who doesn't spend much or need a credit card yet this was one that was great with the 5 year fee waiver and no minimum spending. ", "This student credit card is a must have! With no minimum spending to maintain, it's always good to know you have a credit card you can use without the worry of maintaining a certain monthly spending. Also, there are a ton of perks which come with this card, in particular, you get to enter Zouk for free!! Just make sure you go early to get your chop and you're good to go :-) and also, the card is super sexy, with streaks of glow in the dark artwork. Highly recommended!", 'Useful For students and young adults.   Cashback Card every month on spending  Good Customer Service from DBS  Easy Bill Payment

reviews: "I think it's ok... Among all my other cards, this is the one I use the least. Nothing amazing or outstanding. Could do without... ", "The card design and marketing looks cool, and unfortunately, that's about it. The promise of attractive cashback comes with too many caveats that I didn't bother after a while. "]

Although they increased the minimum spending, BOC also upped some Cashback %, like dining is now 10% Cashback compared to 7%? (I think) before.  Easy to use because there’s no other hoops to jump (eg. Some other cards required minimum

reviews: 'Rating it cheekily. This is the best "dating" card.  Guys will be relieved to know with the BOC card, there is a smaller hole burnt in their pockets with the 10% rebate for local dining and movie tickets. Of course, there is a cap of $30 per billing cycle (approx $30 expenses); so guys don\'t indulge your girlfriends too much with the BOC card :P  ']

reviews: ['A card thats worth it only for the sign up bonus. Subsequently after, it might be good for families that spend most of their time in capitaland mall for the "free carpark".
